snippet: The high-interest loan makers are facing heightened scrutiny, and the Wall Street financiers they depend on are pulling back.
abstract: Some major banks are tightening their lending terms in response to increase in regulation of consumer lending industry; stricter loans, along with increased scrutiny, could have far-reaching implications for consumer lenders and the borrowers they serve.
lead_paragraph: The high-interest loan makers are facing heightened scrutiny, and the Wall Street financiers they depend on are pulling back.

headline.main: With Consumer Lenders Under Regulatory Glare, Big Banks Tighten Purse Strings
headline.print_headline: Subprime Lenders Feel a Pinch in Funding
